intro: Loasa insons, commonly known as the white loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Loasa insons typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or mountainous habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable climates.
